body_content.explanation: the condition or right of being able or allowed to do, say, think, etc. whatever you want to, without being controlled or limited:
examples: I felt such a sense of freedom, up in the hills alone.
Children are allowed much more freedom these days.
In college, you have the freedom to do what you want.
Everyone should be allowed freedom of choice (= the ability to make their own choices).
The Scandinavian countries have a long tradition of protecting the freedom of speech (= the ability to say whatever you want).
Freedom of thought (= the ability to think whatever you want) was denied under the dictatorship.
They are campaigning for freedom of information (= for any information to be allowed to be given to anyone who wants it).
We demand freedom from injustice/persecution (= the condition of not having to suffer these things).

body_content.explanation: a right to act in the way you think you should:
examples: Being able to vote as you want to is an important political/democratic freedom.

body_content.explanation: the state of not being in prison:
examples: They regained their freedom after ten years of unjust imprisonment.

body_content.explanation: to honour someone by giving them special rights in a particular city:
examples: The pensioner will be given the freedom of Chester today at the age of 93.
